post.body:
Yesterday a part of the US web has shut down...

Is Zeronet DDOS attack proof?

If yes, then we need to move on Zeronet the important part of knowledge from the web. Because knowledge is freedom, knowledge must be preserved and freely accessible.

What about syncing (or just static copy) of full wikipedia on Zeronet?

comment.body: No more centralized Ebay, Uber, AirBnb, Paypal, Emails, DNS... no more money and power accumulation from few peoples. It is like if factories are own by workers. But how states will try to prohibit it or shutdown it by filtering packets. Is there reflexions about that at zeronet staff?

I am looking for something similar too.

Idea, use a Raspeberry Pi as modem: Phone <wifi-> Raspberry Pi <Long Range FM-> Raspberry Pi <wifi-> Phone

Phone to phone, but if one phone has 4G signal, it can act as a internet relay.

http://rpi900.com/
